method.name: headerType3
method.comment: here; you don't even have to bother reading the file. just point me to it, and i'll return what i recognize, if anything

method.name: headerType2
method.comment: pass at least the first 4 bytes of your data as a hex string (format XXXXXXXX, eg: AB12CD07...). the bytes need to be raw and represent the first few bytes of the actual object. strings converted to hex bytes will probably not work unless an 8-byte character set has been used. the best way is to ensure raw bytes is to use File.ReadBytes() and pass the bytes (assuming you have access to some file in which the data is stored.

method.name: headerType
method.comment: pass at least the first 4 bytes of your data. best way is to use File.ReadBytes() and pass the bytes. the bytes need to be raw and represent the first few bytes of the actual object. strings converted to bytes will probably not work unless an 8-byte character set has been used.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: necessary step. you can use an empty string as the "event". keeping the door open for future improvements.
